title.narrative: Environmental and Social Capacity Building for the Energy Sector

description.narrative: The development objective of the project would be to: Improve the management of and the accountability for environmental and social issues related to large infrastructure investments, with an initial focus on the energy sector. The Project would initially focus capacity building efforts towards the energy sector, in support of the Energy Sector Development Project. The mobilization of supplemental resources to more explicitly address issues in the mining and transport sectors would be explored during the project's mid-term review. The expected long-term benefits of the project are to: (i) reduce the negative externalities of large infrastructure projects, and (ii) develop a transparent, stable and fair framework for managing environmental and social risks that should comfort large infrastructure investments, and (iii) institutionalizes information flows between the populations affected by large infrastructure projects and other stakeholders, and political decision-makers.

condition.narrative: Financial mgt. + production of quarterly reports
Report on execution of project + related plan
Review by IDA of Procurement decisions

title.narrative: Infrastructure projects in the energy sector approved that comply with int standards for environmental & social issues (KPI)

comment.narrative: percentage per annum
All large Energy Projects submitted to the Interministerial Committee received an Environmental Conformity Certificates.

title.narrative: Non-compliance cases for which legal actions have been taken

comment.narrative: Based on results of the consolidated report of the inspection missions conducted in May 2012, it appears that 174 facilities havebeen inspected, and legal actions have been taken against 46 cases of non-compliance
Indicator not updated by the team.

title.narrative: Audits (security, social, environmental) undertaken for existing infrastructure (annual)

comment.narrative: Indicator not updated by the team.

title.narrative: Energy sector facilities (existing) for which all environmental and social impacts have been identified through an audit process

comment.narrative: No data available beyond March 2012.
No major change.

title.narrative: Sector guidelines on standards and procedural issues that integrate international best practices published

comment.narrative: Only two guidelines were prepared. The remaining one is still under preparation.
The legislation doesn't cover pollution permits and licenses. This indicator was not be able to be reviewed at the MTR process,due to the early cancellation request.

title.narrative: Feedback comments/ questions about env/ social diligence provided monthly on the project website

comment.narrative: The website design has been completed and operational .

title.narrative: Domestic stakeholders with satisfactory understanding of norms and standards in matters of env & social diligence of large projects(KPI)

comment.narrative: No data available beyond May 2012

title.narrative: Facilities for which annual environmental performance report certified as compliant by MinEP with EMP (KPI)

comment.narrative: 24 facilities (21,87%) have implemented their ESMPs in a satisfactory manner;50 facilities (45,45%) have implemented the ESMP inamoderate way; while 15 facilities (13,63%) has an unsatisfactory performance.

title.narrative: Energy sector facilities (existing) for which all enviromental & social impacts have been addressed (KPI)

comment.narrative: Field missions to project sites were suspended since February 2012

title.narrative: EMPs for large electricity infrastructure satisfactorily implemented

comment.narrative: No major change .

title.narrative: EAs for new investments reviewed by Inter-Ministerial Committee (yearly)

comment.narrative: No data available beyond March 2012.

title.narrative: Legislation on land management and compensation systems for involuntary resettlement adopted

comment.narrative: The procurement process stopped due to the cancellation request.

title.narrative: Legal framework on cultural patrimony updated

comment.narrative: Activity stopped following Project's cancellation

title.narrative: Policy to protecting and promoting the rights of marginal populations adopted

comment.narrative: Indicator not met as a result of the cancellation.
The hiring process of the consultant to prepare the draft policy stopped as a result of the project's cancellation.

title.narrative: Reference health database developed (for selected reference sites)

comment.narrative: Reference data for the three main sites (Lom Pangar, Mem vele and Kribi) still not shared by the Ministry of Health (consideredconfidential).

title.narrative: SESA for the energy sector completed and disseminated

comment.narrative: Study is being prepared in the context of another Bank project (PDSEN) following cancellation of PRECESS.
